com.vicinityconcepts.lib.util

Class Service

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vicinityconcepts.lib.util.Service
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Procedure
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Client, ClientManager, Log.LogService, RequestManager, Terminal, Worker

    public abstract class Service
extends java.lang.Object
implements Procedure
    A service is an ongoing processes that performs the same task repeatedly in a loop until explicitly instructed to stop. Services can be started again after they have been stopped.
    Author:
    Ryan Palmer

      • Service

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Initiate execution of this service. Does nothing if this service is already running.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Procedure

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Initiate shutdown of this service. The service will still finish the current iteration of the main execution loop. Does nothing if this service has already been stopped
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Procedure

      • restart

        public void restart()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Restart this service, waiting for it to fully shut down and then starting it again. This is a blocking method that will join the service's thread until it completes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • join

        public void join()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for this service to completely finish execution. Returns immediately if the service has not started yet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • join

        public void join(long timeout)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for this service to completely finish execution, but give up after a specified duration. Returns immediately if the service has not started yet.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Amount of time to wait for this service to finish
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • run0

        private void run0()
        Called after execution is started. This method drives the lifecycle of the service.

      • run

        protected abstract void run()
        Called repeatedly in a loop until the service is stopped. The thread will sleep for the amount of time specified by the loop rate between each call to this method. However, this is merely to prevent loops that would otherwise run too fast. It would be very wise to allow the thread to suspend execution until it has meaningful work to do in your implementation of this method.

      • setLoopRate

        protected void setLoopRate(int rate)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the amount of time that the thread will wait between loops. Use extreme caution when setting this to a low value. Low loop rates can cause a significant resource burden, especially when a lot of services are running at the same time. Loop rates of more than 60 loops per second are not allowed, so this value cannot be less than 1000 / 60.
        Parameters:
        rate - Number of milliseconds to wait
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified loop rate is below the minimum requirement.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Check if this service is running. Even if false, the service may still be in the process of executing its final iteration of the execution loop. To see if the service has finished completely, use isFinished().

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Check if this thread has stopped running and finished all exit activities. Useful if you need to be sure cleanup is done.

      • getName

        public final java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of this service's thread.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Procedure

      • setName

        public final void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name of this service's thread. Service must be restarted for new name to take effect.
